solution_line_template: To buy regular food items individually, they cost ${burger_price_individual} + ${fries_price_individual} + ${soft_drink_price_individual} = $<<{burger_price_individual}+{fries_price_individual}+{soft_drink_price_individual}={individual_regular_cost}>>{individual_regular_cost}.

To buy kids food items individually, they cost ${kids_burger_price_individual} + ${kids_fries_price_individual} + ${kids_juice_box_price_individual} = $<<{kids_burger_price_individual}+{kids_fries_price_individual}+{kids_juice_box_price_individual}={individual_kids_cost}>>{individual_kids_cost}.

If you buy the special burger meal, you save ${individual_regular_cost} - ${special_burger_meal_price} = $<<{individual_regular_cost}-{special_burger_meal_price}={savings_per_regular_meal}>>{savings_per_regular_meal}.
If you buy the kid's meal, you save ${individual_kids_cost} - ${kids_meal_price} = $<<{individual_kids_cost}-{kids_meal_price}={savings_per_kids_meal}>>{savings_per_kids_meal}.

Mr. Parker buys {num_total_burger_meals} special burger meals, bringing his discount to {num_total_burger_meals} x ${savings_per_regular_meal} = $<<{num_total_burger_meals}*{savings_per_regular_meal}={total_savings_regular_meals}>>{total_savings_regular_meals}.

He buys {num_kids_meals_children} kid's meals, bringing his discount to {num_kids_meals_children} x ${savings_per_kids_meal} = $<<{num_kids_meals_children}*{savings_per_kids_meal}={total_savings_kids_meals}>>{total_savings_kids_meals}.
The total savings for Mr. Parker is ${total_savings_regular_meals} + ${total_savings_kids_meals} = $<<{total_savings_regular_meals}+{total_savings_kids_meals}={total_savings}>>{total_savings}.
